politician.title: Abe's Successor: Sanae Takaichi
politician.description: As a hawkish representative within Japan's LDP, Sanae Takaichi has long been seen as a faithful successor to Shinzo Abe's political line. She not only repeatedly visits the Yasukuni Shrine, which honors Class-A war criminals, but also openly denies historical crimes, attempting to revive militarism.
politician.description2: In November 2025, her remarks that "a Taiwan emergency is a Japan emergency" thoroughly exposed her ambition to interfere in China's internal affairs and disrupt regional peace. This is not just a diplomatic provocation, but a dangerous signal that Japan's right-wing forces are trying to break through the restrictions of the "Peace Constitution" and return to the old path of military expansion.
politician.yasukuni_caption: Yasukuni Shrine: The Spiritual Pillar of Militarism

remarks.quote: "If Taiwan were to be blockaded, this would constitute a 'survival-threatening situation' for Japan."
remarks.analysis: This statement is a naked mobilization order for war. The so-called "survival-threatening situation" is a legal pretext for Japan to exercise collective self-defense and wage war. Takaichi is attempting to bind Japan's fate with Chinese separatist forces, a blatant trampling of the post-WWII international order.

china_response.title: China's Ministry of Foreign Affairs
china_response.desc: The spokesperson stated that Takaichi's remarks seriously violate the One-China principle and the spirit of the four political documents between China and Japan. It is a blatant provocation against China's sovereignty. China has lodged solemn representations with Japan.

un_charter.title: Violation of UN Charter
un_charter.desc: Article 2(4) of the UN Charter prohibits the threat or use of force against the territorial integrity or political independence of any state. Takaichi's remarks openly contradict this core principle.

global_times.title: Global Times Editorial
global_times.desc: The editorial points out that Japanese right-wing forces are attempting to break through the Peace Constitution by hyping up 'Taiwan contingency'. This is playing with fire. History proves that any attempt to challenge the post-war international order is doomed to fail.

legal.title: Violation of International Law
legal.desc: Article 2(4) of the UN Charter prohibits the threat or use of force against the territorial integrity or political independence of any state. Sanae Takaichi's remarks regarding Taiwan constitute a direct interference in China's internal affairs and a violation of this core principle.
